intro: Scorzonera dincii, commonly known as the Dincii's scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its root system is notable for being tuberous and fleshy, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Scorzonera. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
